text: can anyone help me by sharing good links regarding the image cropping with rectangle
<@U2L5ZEL4A> you can load image e. g. with Picasso, it can CenterCrop it.

What strategies have people employed in Apps to make a good user experience with regards to being logged in/vs not logged in, particularly letting the user access "what is already local on the device" when the user doesn't have a connection to the server?  For example in a chat app we would expect to be able to see the messages and photos we already got without having to be authenticated again, but the server might require re-authentication if, say, the user went in on the web portal and "revoked all existing sessions" ????  Basically i'm trying to wrap my head around whether it would make for a good or bad experience if the user suddenly in the middle of using the app is told that because they are trying to go online they need to authenticate....
